result.execSummary:
The defendant Stephen N Newman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Receiving or Concealing Stolen Property (<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Joint and several with co-defendant Tyrel Zurcher in 15CM328.
7/18/16: RESTITUTION AMOUNT CORRECTED TO $2550.00.

In the event of non-payment of outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Stephen N Newman in court telephonically from Dodge Correctional Institution with attorney Frederick A Bechtold.  Rachel Kibbe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
THIS COVERS 15CM329 & 15CM519
Parties agree to proceed with the hearing by telephone. State relates agreement. Victim impact statement filed. 
15CM329 - State moves to amend count 2 to 943.34(1)(a). Court grants amendment. State moves to dismiss and read in count 4 and 15CM519. Court orders count 4 and 15CM519 be dismissed and read-in. 
Defendant pleads guilty to amended count 2 in 15CM329. Court accepts the plea and finds the Defendant guilty. 

Court relates and orders: 
$2550.00 Restitution to be joint and several with co-defendant Tyrel Zurcher in 15CM328
Must submit DNA sample and pay the surcharge. 
Costs.

(clerked by RW)
Attorney Frederick A Bechtold in court.  Rachel Kibbe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. THIS COVERS 15CM519 AND 15CM329.
Defendant in prison. Reset. 

Minutes to JA to schedule video.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 8, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Plea hearing on June 29, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Jury trial - 12 person on July 15, 2016 at 08:00 am.

Attorney Frederick A Bechtold in court.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CM329 and 15CM519 called.  Defendant is in the Chippewa County Jail.

Defendant Stephen N Newman in court.  Defendant Stephen N Newman in custody.  Rachel Kibbe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

THIS COURT RECORD COVERS 15CF575, 15CM519 AND 15CM329

15CF575:  State moves to dismiss case.  Court grants motion.

15CM519 and 15CM329:  Plea hearing set.  
3/02/16 at 3:00 PM
Bond(s) to continue.
If defendant does not hear from Public Defender by next week, he should contact their Eau Claire office.

THIS BOND COVERS 15CF575, 15CM519 AND 15CM329.
Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191.  
Must have no contact with M.S.G. d/o/b 7-14-80 or Eric F.

Clerked by CS
Defendant Stephen N Newman in court with attorney Ryan O'Hara for today.  Defendant Stephen N Newman in custody.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. THIS COVERS 15CF575, 15CM329 AND 15CM519. 
15CM329: State moves to quash warrant. Court quashes the warrant. Defendant pleads not guilty. Track with CF case.
15CM519: Defendant pleads not guilty. Track with CF case.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 21, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Stephen N Newman not in court.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State moves for warrant.  Court finds probable cause and orders warrant - $500.00 - N10-W51.
